content: There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so the curr_chunk cannot be summarized. Section 8903 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include high deductible health plans that provide specific benefits. Additionally, section 8904(a) is amended to include benefits from high deductible health plans. Section 8903a(a) of title 5, United States Code is amended to include plans described by section 8903(5). Section 8906(b)(2) is amended to allow payment of the full amount for high deductible health plans. Additionally, a new subsection is added to provide government contributions to medical savings accounts for employees or annuitants enrolled in high deductible health plans. Government contributions will be made into the medical savings account of employees or annuitants enrolled in high deductible health plans if the contribution exceeds the plan's total subscription charge. Contributions will be made on the same basis as other government contributions. Maximum government contribution for part-time employees will be determined under subsection (b)(3). Designations must be made as per Office regulations. Subsections (f), (g), and (h) apply to these contributions. Government contributions will be made into the medical savings account of employees or annuitants enrolled in high deductible health plans as required by Office regulations. The terms 'medical savings account' and 'high deductible health plan' are defined in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Amendments are made to disregard high deductible health plans in determining government contributions levels. The amendments made by this section apply to contract years starting after December 31, 1997. SEC. 2. PROVISIONS RELATING TO THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986. Section 220 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include the Federal Employees Health Benefit Plan. The Federal Government is treated as a small employer, and limitations on deductions apply to individuals enrolled in specific health plans under title 5, United States Code. Deductions for these individuals are reduced in coordination with employer contributions. The amendment to Section 220 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes limitations on deductions for individuals enrolled in specific health plans under title 5, United States Code. The deduction for such individuals is reduced by the amount that would be included in their gross income, with numerical limitations and a sunset provision. This amendment applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1997.
